forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 3 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Slight Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 3 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Tonight, Downtown San Francisco is cloaked in a gentle shroud of clouds, with rain likely to accompany the nightfall. The temperature quietly hovers around a mild 56 degrees, softened further by a light breeze whispering from the south-southeast. The chance of precipitation stands at a respectable 60%, hinting at subtle rainfall that may sprinkle the streets, rendering the pavement glistening—a postcard picture of the city under an overcast sky.

As morning unfurls, the forecast holds a slight chance of rain after 4 PM, yet the day is set to be predominantly cloudy with highs nearing 62 degrees before gracefully slipping toward a cooler 60. The wind, a nonchalant companion, will continue its gentle embrace, ranging between 3 to 9 mph. The atmosphere has a muted charm, perfect for cozy gatherings or leisurely strolls beneath the majestic façades of the city. You might consider reaching for a light jacket, perhaps layered over a soft sweater, to fend off both the evening chill and the occasional drizzle. As dusk approaches, indoor spaces beckon, inviting you to settle in with a good book or explore the culinary delights that dot the neighborhood, best appreciated over a steaming cup of something warm.
